ygData.subject: More OT stuff: Invisibility
ygData.msgSnippet: ... The assumption is, if you are in the group, you wish to be bound.  If you don t want to be bound, disband before the spell is completed. ... None, anymore.
ygData.messageBody:
At 02:59 PM 7/14/99 -0500, you wrote:
>From: silky@...
>
>Well hell - REAL simple solution to this - just have something popup to
>accept a bind.

The assumption is, if you are in the group, you wish to be bound. If you
don't want to be bound, disband before the spell is completed.

>How many magic users loose their pets to some idiot that thinks it's cute
>to invis them?

None, anymore. They nailed that bug - you can only cast invis on someone
in your group. And then, see the above answer.

>With levitate bugs - I HATE someone just doing that without asking me.

The only possible detrimental effect I see of levitate is if you are
swimming, and suddenly levitated, wouldn't you pop to the surface? Since
EQ apparently has a major problem with distinguishing vertical difference,
any creature on the bottom of the ocean can attack you as though you were
standing on it's head. Very annoying, because that means that you can't
attack it, but it can attack you. *ahem* Nice double standard here,
programmers. Can I report a death like that as a bug, since obviously, the
monsters are exploiting it...

Talies the Wanderer
